userdoc.notice: Contract only exists to add a spacer to the CrossDomainMessenger where the         libAddressManager variable used to exist. Must be the first contract in the inheritance         tree of the CrossDomainMessenger.

documentation.text: @notice Current message version identifier.
@notice Constant overhead added to the base gas for a message.
@notice Numerator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message.
@notice Denominator for dynamic overhead added to the base gas for a message.
@notice Extra gas added to base gas for each byte of calldata in a message.
@notice Gas reserved for performing the external call in `relayMessage`.
@notice Gas reserved for finalizing the execution of `relayMessage` after the safe call.

@notice Gas reserved for the execution between the `hasMinGas` check and the external
         call in `relayMessage`.

@notice Address of the sender of the currently executing message on the other chain. If the
         value of this variable is the default value (0x00000000...dead) then no message is
         currently being executed. Use the xDomainMessageSender getter which will throw an
         error if this is the case.

@notice CrossDomainMessenger contract on the other chain.
 @custom:network-specific

@notice Emitted whenever a message is successfully relayed on this chain.
 @param msgHash Hash of the message that was relayed.

@notice Emitted whenever a message fails to be relayed on this chain.
 @param msgHash Hash of the message that failed to be relayed.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "CrossDomainMessenger: only version 0 or 1 messages are supported at this time"
